intro: Crotalaria benadirensis, commonly known as the Benadirensis Crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a short life cycle and is often found in disturbed soils. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, which aids in seed dispersal.
